title: 5 dead in mass shooting on Caribbean island of St. Vincent: Police
description: Authorities are on high alert in St. Vincent and the Grenadines, following a shooting incident that left five people dead.

title: A helicopter pilot is killed in a crash in western Canada while fighting fires
description: A helicopter pilot has been killed in a crash in western Canada in the third death in recent days connected with efforts to fight fires in the country’s worst wildfire season on record

title: Pioneering hacker Kevin Mitnick, FBI-wanted felon turned security guru, dead at 59
description: Kevin Mitnick, whose pioneering antics tricking employees in the 1980s and 1990s into helping him steal software and services from big phone and tech companies made him the most celebrated U.S. hacker, has died at age 59

title: Police investigating Gilgo Beach murder suspect for ties to missing teen
description: Police in South Carolina said they are investigating whether Gilgo Beach murder suspect Rex Heuermann may have been involved in the 2014 disappearance of a teenager.

title: Ocean heat wave could devastate marine life: Experts
description: Oceans all over the world are experiencing warmer-than-normal temperatures, but waters off the southern U.S. could be on the brink of an ocean heat wave emergency.

title: ABC News Exclusive: Inside the US nuclear ballistic missile submarine in South Korea
description: Martha Raddatz reports from the first such sub to visit near North Korea.

title: Divers poised to search for children washed away in Pennsylvania flash flood
description: The search for a 2-year-old girl and her 9-month-old sister who were washed away with their mother in a flash flood in Pennsylvania is expected to be scaled back.

title: A Miami mother tried to hire a hitman to kill her 3-year-old son, police say. She's been arrested
description: Miami police say an 18-year-old mother tried to hire a hitman to kill her 3-year-old son, who was living with his grandmother at the time

title: 18-year-old Nebraska woman sentenced to 90 days in jail for burning fetus after abortion
description: An 18-year-old Nebraska woman has been sentenced to 90 days in jail and two years of probation for burning and burying a fetus after she took medication from her mother to end her pregnancy

title: WATCH:  Watch this adorable toddler overcome her fear of asking for a cupcake
description: Mom Carly Cuisia caught this precious moment of her daughter, Frankie, working up the courage to ask for a cupcake.

title: Senate committee advances SCOTUS ethics bill after alleged justice misconduct
description: The Senate Judiciary Committee on Thursday voted to advance legislation that would require the U.S. Supreme Court to adopt a binding code of ethics

title: WATCH:  Alligators cross South Carolina park's pathway
description: A pathway in a South Carolina state park lived up to its "Alligator Alley" nickname as multiple gators stepped out from the woodwork to cross the walkway.

title: Public funding for King Charles III and royals has been recalculated due to windfarm deal profits
description: The U.K. Treasury says the amount of public funding for King Charles III and the royal family’s official duties has been recalculated for next year because of an unexpected profit boost from offshore wind farms on the monarch’s Crown Estate

title: Home sales in June fell to the slowest pace since January with near-historic low inventory for sale
description: Sales of previously occupied U.S. homes fell in June to the slowest pace since January, as a near-historic low number of homes for sale and rising mortgage rates kept many would-be homebuyers on the sidelines

title: Russia seeks a 20-year prison term for Kremlin foe Navalny in closed trial, ally says
description: Prosecutors are asking a Russian court to sentence imprisoned opposition leader Alexei Navalny to a further 20 years in prison on extremism charges, according to his ally

title: EF3 tornado rips through North Carolina amid extreme weather nationwide
description: The tornado is part of a system of severe weather threatening some 57 million Americans, while extreme heat puts more than 100 million Americans at risk.

title: Ukraine and Pakistan call for restoring the Black Sea grain deal after talks in Islamabad
description: The foreign ministers of Ukraine and Pakistan have called for the restoration of the Black Sea grain initiative to ensure global food security

title: US military emails sent to Mali because of common typo
description: A typo has reportedly resulted in thousands of emails intended for the U.S. military being sent to Mali, an issue that the Pentagon said its taken steps to mitigate.

title: US jobless claims fall again as labor market continues to flash strength
description: Fewer Americans applied for unemployment benefits last week as the labor market continues to show fortitude in the face of higher interest rates

title: Jury awards Florida girl burned by McDonald's Chicken McNugget $800,000 in damages
description: A South Florida jury awarded $800,000 in damages to a little girl who received second-degree burns when a hot Chicken McNugget fell on her leg as her mother pulled away from the drive-thru of a McDonald’s restaurant

title: Tesla recalling nearly 16,000 of its 2021-2023 Model S and Model X vehicles
description: Tesla is recalling nearly 16,000 of its 2021-2023 Model S and Model X vehicles because some front-row seat belts may not have been reconnected properly following a repair

title: WATCH:  Drone video shows blaze engulfing building in Mykolaiv after Russian attack
description: At least 19 people were injured overnight in Mykolaiv, a southern city close to the Black Sea, the region's governor said.

title: Texas Department of Public Safety speaks out on migrant abuse allegations
description: Texas authorities are doubling down and pushing back on disturbing allegations of migrant abuse along the United States-Mexico border.

title: WATCH:  This artist uses mountain slopes as his canvas
description: On the mountain slopes in this Swiss village, an artist has used chalk and charcoal to paint two giant frescos of children sketching how they see the vast world around them.

title: China doesn’t want US trade war but will retaliate against curbs, ambassador says
description: China's ambassador to the United States says it does not want a trade war but will retaliate against any further U.S. restrictions on technology and trade

title: Pop star Shakira is to face a second tax probe from Spain
description: Pop star Shakira is facing more trouble from Spain’s tax office after a court near Barcelona agreed to open an investigation into a second case of alleged tax fraud by the Colombian singer

title: Alabama to carry out first lethal injection after review of execution procedures
description: Alabama plans to execute an inmate for the 2001 beating death of a woman as the state seeks to carry out its first lethal injection after a pause following a string of problems with inserting the IVs

title: 'Stay indoors': Lion on the loose in Berlin prompts urgent citywide search
description: A lion is loose in Berlin, prompting authorities in Germany to send emergency alerts to thousands of people in Berlin warning them to stay indoors.

title: New York City agrees to pay $13 million to protesters in class action
description: New York City has agreed to pay more than $13 million to settle a civil rights lawsuit brought on behalf of roughly 1,300 people who were arrested or beaten by police during racial injustice demonstrations that swept through the city during the summer ...

title: Jan. 6 grand jury will speak with at least 1 more witness: Sources
description: At least one witness is expected to appear Thursday before the grand jury investigating former President Trump's efforts to overturn the 2020 election, sources say.

title: Delta passengers fall sick while waiting on Vegas tarmac in triple-digit temperatures
description: At least one Delta passenger was taken to the hospital for heat-related illness after the plane sat on the tarmac in Las Vegas, where temperatures reached triple digits.

title: US halts funding access to Wuhan lab at heart of COVID-19 origins debate
description: Funding has been suspended to the Wuhan Institute of Virology

title: Tornado damages Pfizer plant in North Carolina as scorching heat, floods sock other parts of US
description: A tornado has heavily damaged a major Pfizer pharmaceutical plant in North Carolina — the latest in a string of extreme weather events plaguing the U.S. Torrential rains flooded communities in Kentucky while an area from California to South Florida end...

title: Trump screens 'Sound of Freedom,' seeking to rally evangelicals with trafficking fear
description: Trump on Wednesday night will host a screening of the film "Sound of Freedom" at his golf club in Bedminster, New Jersey, with Tim Ballard and Jim Caviezel

title: Tropical Storm Calvin passes over Hawaii, leaving minor flooding in its wake
description: Tropical Storm Calvin has brought high surf, heavy rain and gusts to parts of Hawaii's Big Island but only left minor flooding in its wake

title: Canada's Trudeau convenes a crisis group over Canadian port strike as union gives 72-hour notice
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau met with top officials after the longshore union renewed a 72-hour strike notice after already halting shipments in and out of ports in Canada’s west coast region of British Columbia for nearly two weeks

title: 4 members of a Florida family are convicted of selling a fake COVID-19 cure through online church
description: Four members of a Florida family have been convicted of selling a toxic industrial bleach as a fake COVID-19 cure through their online church
